profile_data.summary:
Data Engineer and AI Researcher with 7+ years of experience specializing in data pipeline development, cloud migrations, and AI solutions. Currently conducting HIPAA-compliant healthcare research at Seattle University, where I've achieved an 88% accuracy in asthma prediction using transfer learning and ensemble modeling techniques - a 20% improvement over existing classifiers and 12% improvement over neural networks.

As a Data Engineer at Yardi Systems, I led transformative initiatives reducing deployment costs by 75% and processing time by 40% through optimized ETL pipelines and BI solutions. Orchestrated cross-functional collaboration across 4 teams spanning 3 time zones while maintaining 99.99% system availability, serving 50+ Middle East clients.

My expertise spans:
• Data Engineering & ETL: SSIS, data modeling, pipeline monitoring, data governance
• Cloud & Infrastructure: AWS (S3, EC2, EKS, DynamoDB, Transcribe, SageMaker), Docker, Kubernetes
• Machine Learning & AI: Transfer learning, ensemble modeling, LLMs, RAG systems, BERT
• Programming: Python, PySpark, SQL, TensorFlow, PyTorch, LangChain

Recent achievements include developing a RAG-based meeting insight extraction system (90% BERT similarity, 89% precision/recall), publishing research in DAWAK 2024 and SAC 2025, and leading research collaborations with the Korean government for historic pattern analysis of asthma patients and Washington state farmers for agricultural yield prediction using UAV and IoT data.

Currently seeking opportunities to leverage my technical expertise and research experience in roles focused on data engineering, machine learning, and AI solution architecture, with a particular interest in healthcare and agricultural technology applications.
profile_data.headline: Data Engineer | Artificial Intelligence | Machine Learning

experience.description:
•	Conducted HIPAA-compliant research for asthma patients using transfer learning techniques to develop personalized ensemble models.
•	Achieved 88% accuracy in asthma prediction by performing comparative analysis while working with sparse medical data. This represented a 20% improvement compared to existing classifiers and a 12% improvement over neural network models.
•	Completed CITI Program certifications in research ethics and human subject research, ensuring compliance and ethical conduct in data handling.
•	Published research papers outlining findings and detailing advanced machine learning techniques for enhancing medical predictions.
•	Currently working on research projects with a Korean Hospital on historic pattern analysis of asthma patients and with Washington state farmers for farming yield prediction using UAV and IOT for accurate insurance premiums and smoother claims process.

publications.name: A Retrieval-Augmented Framework For Meeting Insight Extraction
publications.description:
Meetings are vital for collaboration, but recalling key details can be challenging and impact productivity. To address this, we developed a solution leveraging Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG) techniques. Users can upload meeting records, query for relevant information, and receive precise responses generated by a Large Language Model (LLM). Our system groups meetings based on abstractive summaries using advanced clustering algorithms and retrieves relevant conversations from a Pinecone vector store database. With optimized encoders and fine-tuned LLMs, our approach enhances meeting summarization, content discovery, and information retrieval for improved productivity.

Accepted, To be published in 2025

publications.name: Incremental SMOTE with Control Coefficient for Classifiers in   Data Starved Medical Applications
publications.publisher: Big Data Analytics and Knowledge Discovery
publications.description: Prediction models for data-starved medical applications lag behind general machine learning-based solutions, despite the fact that the development of machine learning techniques has shown promise for improving early interventions. This is due to the fact that optimization approaches used to train models implicitly assume a balanced distribution of events in training data, yet medical data frequently has an imbalanced distribution of data samples within classes. The curse of dimensionality is further exacerbated by the fact that small samples and a high number of features make up the data for individual-based risk prediction models. In this paper, we propose a data augmentation method to gradually create synthetic minority samples with control coefficient, which improves the quality of the generated data over time and consequently boosts prediction model performance. This is achieved by incrementally adjusting to the data distribution and thus avoiding overfitting the training data. We further employ four cutting-edge oversampling techniques to evaluate the proposed technique on real asthma patient data. results of our study show that this method enhanced classifiers' overall performance across all four techniques. Specifically, by using the incremental data augmentation method on three oversampling methods, the transfer learning-based classifiers led to an increase in sensitivity of 4.01%–7.79%.

projects.description:
o	Engineered a scalable, cloud-native SAAS application for employee management using Python and AWS services (S3, DynamoDB), implementing a microservices architecture to ensure modularity and ease of maintenance.

member.occupation: Data Engineer | Artificial Intelligence | Machine Learning

projects.description:
o	Developed a scalable, Docker-containerized system leveraging Claude AI to create two key agents: an Analyzer Agent for examining CSV structure and patterns, and a Generator Agent for producing synthetic data rows based on the analysis. Implemented efficient batch processing to manage large dataset generation while optimizing API token consumption.
o	Utilized the Anthropic API and Claude 3.5 Sonnet model to power the AI agents, incorporating advanced prompt engineering techniques to ensure high-fidelity data generation. Designed a user-friendly command-line interface for specifying input files and desired output sizes, enhancing usability for data scientists and researchers.
o	Implemented robust CSV parsing and writing functionalities to handle various data formats, ensuring compatibility with diverse input datasets. Incorporated secure API key management through environment variables, enhancing the system's security and deployability across different environments.
o	Published the Docker image to Docker Hub for easy distribution and deployment, enabling seamless integration into various data pipelines and research workflows. Created comprehensive documentation to facilitate adoption and further development by the open-source community.
o	Tech Stack: Python, Docker, Anthropic API, Claude AI, CSV manipulation, Environment management, Command-line interfaces
projects.title: Generating Synthetic Data Using AI Agents with Claude and Docker

projects.description:
Tableau project for mapping meteor crashes worldwide

Our motivation for the project stemmed from our interest in space and to visualize how many meteors crash on earth.
We wanted to visualize number of meteorite landing on earth over time.
We wanted to discuss the threat posed by large meteor impacts, and the need for monitoring and understanding these events to help develop strategies to protect earth from future collisions.
We wanted to study meteor crashes in proximity to high density areas and stress the importance of international committee to predict and understand meteor crashes.
projects.title: Meteor Mapper

projects.description:
o	Developed a Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG) system to answer user queries for audio/video meeting recordings. Optimized token consumption by leveraging semantic graph clustering (FAISS), achieving a 90% BERT similarity score and 89% precision/recall score with clustering.
o	Stored transcript chunk embeddings in Pinecone serverless vector DB to optimize semantic search, achieving 85% cosine similarity.
o	Performed A/B testing with prompt optimization and Large Language Models (LLMs) from OpenAI, Claude, and Google, implementing semantic routing to improve response quality.
o	Enhanced chatbot persona by fine-tuning the Llama 2 (7B) model using QLoRA, incorporating domain-specific knowledge and reducing hallucinations to improve LLM responses.
o	Created and deployed a prototype using Streamlit on Hugging Face Spaces, contributing to the open-source and AI community.
o	Tech Stack: Python, Transformers, LangChain, Pinecone, Hugging Face, LLM, RAG, AWS, NLP, GenAI
